title: Propulsion Assignment
description: This assignment covers the principles of propulsion systems, including rocket engines and jet engines. You will be expected to analyze thrust equations and calculate fuel efficiency for various propulsion systems.

title: Combustion Analysis
description: In this assignment, you will study the combustion process in engines, focusing on fuel types and efficiency. The task includes creating models for heat release and combustion rates.

title: Nozzle Design Project
description: This project will require you to design an efficient nozzle for high-speed exhaust flow. You will evaluate design parameters like nozzle contour, exit pressure, and expansion ratios.

title: Aerodynamics Quiz
description: This quiz will test your understanding of aerodynamic principles including lift, drag, and flow behavior around various shapes. Be prepared for both multiple-choice and short-answer questions.

title: Flow Analysis
description: In this assignment, you will analyze fluid flow in different configurations. Topics include laminar and turbulent flows, boundary layers, and flow separation.

title: Heating Analysis
description: This assignment focuses on heat transfer in engineering systems. You will calculate heat flux, analyze thermal gradients, and determine heat exchanger performance.

title: Structural Design Task
description: You will be tasked with designing a lightweight, load-bearing structure for aerospace applications. The design should maximize strength-to-weight ratio while adhering to safety standards.

title: Orbital Calculations
description: This assignment involves calculating orbital parameters such as velocity, period, and energy for various types of orbits. You will also analyze perturbations in orbital mechanics.

title: Systems Engineering Exam
description: The exam will cover core concepts in systems engineering, including system design, lifecycle management, and risk analysis. Make sure to review system integration processes and requirements management.
